intro: Anotis thymifolia var. ericoides, commonly known as the Ericoid Anotis, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant features small, leathery leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. It produces white or pale pink flowers in late winter to early spring, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. This variety is well adapted to nutrient-poor soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal scrub environments.
